meanings.sent1: The two chess players were stalemating each other, unable to make any progress.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations between the two countries ended up stalemating, with neither side willing to compromise.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were stalemating over which TV show to watch, each refusing to give in.
meanings.sent4: The political deadlock was stalemating the passing of any new laws, leaving the country in a state of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam was stalemating the entire highway, causing frustration among drivers.

meanings.definition: The act of causing a stalemate.
meanings.sent1: The stalemating of the negotiations led to a standstill in the peace talks.
meanings.sent2: The stalemating of the two chess players resulted in a draw.
meanings.sent3: The siblings' constant stalemating over chores made their parents laugh at their stubbornness.
meanings.sent4: The stalemating of the project was a setback for the team, delaying their progress.
meanings.sent5: The stalemating of the traffic lights caused chaos at the intersection, with cars honking impatiently.
